0.title: Taiwan reports 121 new COVID-19 cases, zero deaths in last 24 hours
0.article_body: Taiwan on Sunday logged 121 new COVID-19 cases and zero deaths in last 24 hours. As per Taiwan's Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC), out of 121 new cases, 118 were imported cases and three were locally transmitted infections. Out of the new local infections, two were connected to a cluster in Chiayi and third was reported in Tainan, added CECC.

1.title: Was rejected several times due to women investors' absence: Nykaa Fashion CEO
1.article_body: Nykaa Fashion CEO Adwaita Nayar said she and Co-founder Falguni Nayar were rejected by several investors as they didn't have women in decision-making positions. "All of them said no-no, we're not interested. The same investors who are now super interested," Nayar said. She added that if women don't hold key positions, it becomes difficult for investors to understand women-centric businesses.

2.title: At least 902 civilians killed, 1,459 injured in Ukraine: UN
2.article_body: Office of UN High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) on Sunday said at least 902 civilians were killed in Ukraine since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24. UN human rights office added that 1,459 residents were injured in Ukraine so far. The office added that most of the fatalities were from heavy artillery shelling, multiple-launch rocket systems, missiles and airstrikes.

3.title: Will ensure stability: Nirmala on Biren Singh being Manipur CM again
3.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday termed the unanimous election of N Biren Singh as Manipur's CM for a second term a "good decision". "It'll ensure that Manipur has a stable and responsible government," she added. Singh was elected as CM in BJP's legislature party meeting in Imphal, 10 days after BJP won 32 Assembly seats in Manipur elections.

4.title: BSF seizes ancient idol meant to be smuggled to Bangladesh, 1 held
4.article_body: A person was apprehended by the BSF in West Bengal's Dakshin Dinajpur district on Sunday for illegally possessing a 12-centimetre-tall ancient metallic sculpture of Lord Ganesha. According to BSF officials, the person, who is an Indian national, was planning to smuggle the sculpture to Bangladesh. The accused has been handed over to the police for further action, officials added.

5.title: Disclose information of 360 US-controlled labs across world: Russia
5.article_body: Russia has said that it supports China's demand asking the US to disclose information about activities of 360 American-controlled labs in the world. China had made the demand at the United Nations Security Council (UNSC). Separately, Russia said it has discovered new details indicating that components of biological weapons were being developed in Ukraine.

6.title: Patriot air defence system start arriving in Slovakia from NATO partners
6.article_body: Slovakia on Sunday said the Patriot air defence system have started arriving in the country from its NATO partners and its deployment will continue in the coming days. Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has prompted NATO to boost its defences. The Patriot is a long-range system capable of automatically detecting and intercepting an aircraft within a radius of over 100 kilometres.

7.title: New colours, same commitment: LSG skipper KL Rahul practices for IPL
7.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants skipper KL Rahul took to Twitter to share pictures of him practising in the nets ahead of the upcoming season of IPL. "New colours, same commitment," he wrote. The 29-year-old, who earlier represented PBKS, was bought by LSG for ₹17 crore before IPL mega auction 2022. With 626 runs, Rahul was top-scorer for PBKS in IPL 2021.

8.title: I'm highly hopeful of performing: Babar on playing first-ever Test in Lahore
8.article_body: Ahead of third Pakistan-Australia Test, Pakistan captain Babar Azam said he's "highly" hopeful of performing in his first-ever Test at his home-ground in Lahore. He added that he can't explain the feeling of playing in front of the home crowd. The 27-year-old played his highest Test innings (425-ball 196) in last match in Karachi. The Test will begin on Monday.

9.title: I salute India today, it always maintains an independent foreign policy: Pak PM
9.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan has praised India's foreign policy and said that it's 'better than that of Pakistan'. "I salute India today. It has always maintained an independent foreign policy," said Khan. "India is importing oil from Russia which is facing sanctions. This is because India's foreign policy is for the betterment of its people," he further said.

10.title: AIUDF to back Congress' Ripun Bora in Rajya Sabha biennial polls
10.article_body: All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) will back Congress' Ripun Bora in upcoming Rajya Sabha biennial elections, AIUDF's leader Aminul Islam has said. "We went to Delhi, where we had a meeting with Congress high command...Sonia Gandhi requested AIUDF chief...to support [Bora]...We agreed," he added. Congress has named Ripun Bora as its candidate from Assam for elections on March 31.

11.title: Abhishek Banerjee to appear before ED in coal scam case tomorrow
11.article_body: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee will appear before ED in Delhi in the coal scam case on Monday. At the Kolkata airport, he said, "BJP government is taking on TMC by using Central agencies. We've defeated them and they cannot digest this." He added, "I'm ready to bow down before the power of people but not before the people in power."

12.title: Pakistan logs 375 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death in last 24 hours
12.article_body: Pakistani authorities on Sunday said the country reported 375 new daily COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours taking the overall caseload to over 15 lakh. As per Pakistan's National Command and Operation Centre (NCOC), one new death was recorded taking the total death toll to 30,329. Meanwhile, Sindh province remains the country's worst-hit region with over 5,70,000 cases so far.

13.title: Rajasthan government proposes Right to Health Care Bill
13.article_body: Rajasthan government has proposed the Right to Health Care Bill and sought suggestions on its draft till March 24. Under the Bill, denial of health care services at any health care facility will invite a fine of up to ₹10,000. It will also ensure free treatment in government hospitals and in private hospitals established through land allocation on concessional rates.

14.title: US plans to resume oil, gas development on federal lands
14.article_body: US government on Friday said it plans to resume oil and gas development on federal lands. This comes after a court order allowed the government to continue imposing the value of around $50 per ton of greenhouse gases emitted. "With this ruling, the department continues its planning for responsible oil and gas development..." said US Interior Department spokesperson Melissa Schwartz.

15.title: Pope Francis visits Ukrainian children war refugees in Rome's hospital
15.article_body: Pope Francis on Saturday visited Ukrainian children war refugees being treated in a paediatric hospital in Rome. As per the Vatican, 19 Ukrainian children are currently being treated for cancer, neurological conditions or serious war injuries caused by explosions. "The blood and tears of children, the suffering of women, men who are defending their land... shakes our conscience," Francis said.

16.title: 20-yr-old woman raped inside public toilet near railway station in UP
16.article_body: A 20-year-old woman was allegedly raped inside a public toilet located near a parking stand at Uttar Pradesh’s Pratapgarh railway station. As per the police, the woman was waiting for a train with her husband at the platform. While she looked for a washroom, the accused gave her access to a clean washroom and raped her there, police added.

17.title: Study proposes moon's orbit as gravitational wave detector
17.article_body: An international team of researchers proposed that a natural gravitational wave detector exists in the Earth-Moon system. They stated that gravitational waves that constantly hit the system produce tiny deviations in Moon's orbit that are measured in the microhertz frequency range. The scientists used this range to propose a new form of studying gravitational waves emitted by the distant universe.

18.title: IFS officer shares pic of sign dedicated to sparrow killed in police firing in Guj
18.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan on Sunday shared a picture of a plaque dedicated to a sparrow that was killed in police firing in March 1974 in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. The picture, shared on the occasion of World Sparrow Day, went viral. As per Kaswan, this is the only plaque in the world dedicated to a sparrow, adding, "People are beautiful".

19.title: 2 die waiting in line to buy fuel in Sri Lanka amid economic crisis
19.article_body: Two men collapsed and died in Sri Lanka while waiting in separate queues to buy fuel amid a widespread shortage caused by an economic crisis in the country. "One was a 70-year-old three-wheeler driver...while the second was a 72-year-old," the Sri Lankan Police said on Sunday. "Both had been waiting in line for about four hours," they added.

20.title: Amazon HQ construction on sacred land halted by South African court
20.article_body: The construction of Amazon's new headquarters in South Africa has been halted by a court after the descendants of the country's earliest inhabitants said the land it would be built on is sacred. "This matter ultimately concerns the rights of indigenous peoples," the judge said. Earlier, activists urged Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie Scott to help block the construction.

21.title: Decision on swearing-in of Goa CM to be taken tomorrow: Sawant
21.article_body: Goa caretaker CM Pramod Sawant said the decision about the swearing-in ceremony of the next CM will be taken during a legislature party meeting on Monday. Sawant and his party colleague Vishwajit Rane met Union Home Minister Amit Shah in Delhi on Saturday. Union Ministers Narendra Singh Tomar and L Murugan are observers to oversee government formation in the state.

22.title: Hyd Police inaugurate 30 CCTV cameras in Vikas Nagar colony
22.article_body: Hyderabad Police has inaugurated 30 CCTV cameras at Vikas Nagar colony. The news was announced on the official Twitter handle of Rachakonda Police with pictures that showed police officials holding the CCTV opening ceremony in the area. The post read the cameras were inaugurated with the help of the colony association, Municipal Chairman Chandra Reddy and others.

23.title: B'luru park's recharge wells expected to tackle city's water crisis
23.article_body: Recharge wells at Bengaluru's Cubbon Park are expected to tackle the city's water crisis. The park's decades-old seven open wells were de-silted and cleaned after being left unused and neglected. The wells now provide the park over a lakh litre of water daily, with 73 rainwater recharge wells dug up to ensure they never run out of water.

24.title: PMC organises photography & video shooting training for urban poor
24.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation and the Social Development Department have launched an initiative to provide photography and video shooting training to the urban poor living in the Pune municipal area. The initiative will provide both basic and advanced training for a period of six months. The initiative is for people in the age group of 15-45.

25.title: BMC removes 782 abandoned vehicles from Mumbai roads
25.article_body: The BMC removed 782 abandoned vehicles from Mumbai roads last week and issued notices to 2,381 vehicle owners to remove their vehicles from roads in 24 administrative wards. The vehicles which aren't removed by owners will be seized and auctioned, officials said. This comes after Mumbai Police Commissioner held a joint meeting with BMC and police officials regarding abandoned vehicles.

26.title: Russia & Ukraine nearing agreement on 'critical' issues: Turkey
26.article_body: Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu has said that Russia and Ukraine were nearing an agreement on "critical" issues. Çavuşoğlu added that he was hopeful for a ceasefire in the war if both countries don't backtrack on talks. The countries were getting closer on issues, including renouncing Ukraine's NATO ambitions and demilitarisation, Al Jazeera quoted a Turkish official as saying.

27.title: Mumbai Police arrest man for kidnapping & marrying 15-yr-old girl
27.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested a 21-year-old man who allegedly kidnapped and illegally married a 15-year-old girl in Shirdi. According to a report, the girl had failed to return home after appearing for her class 10 exam following which her parents lodged a missing complaint. She was sent for a hospital check-up by police after she returned the next day.

28.title: Man arrested in B'luru for smuggling guns, revolvers from Maha
28.article_body: A 29-year-old man has been arrested by the Bengaluru Police for allegedly smuggling guns and revolvers from Maharashtra and selling them at higher prices in the city. Police said they have seized two pistols and four live bullets from his possession. The man had cases pending against him for smuggling weapons, the police further said.

29.title: Delhi driver fakes robbery to steal ₹20 lakh to please girlfriends
29.article_body: A 24-year-old driver was arrested for planning a fake robbery to steal ₹20 lakh from his employer to please his girlfriends, in Delhi's Civil Lines, police said. Sushil Aggarwal (52), on Wednesday, had sent the driver with the cash. However, the accused claimed to have been robbed while changing the car's tyre, said DCP (north) Sagar Singh Kalsi.

30.title: 22-yr-old man killed during fight over loud music on Holi in Delhi
30.article_body: A 22-year-old man was allegedly stabbed to death and his 20-year-old brother was injured by six men, who attacked the two over playing loud music in Delhi's Punjabi Bagh area, police said. Deputy Commissioner of Police (west) Ghanshyam Bansal said that Manoj (22) was "declared brought dead by the doctors, whereas his brother received five stitches on his scalp."

31.title: Female theatre artist attacked with acid in Bengaluru; 3 arrested
31.article_body: A female theatre artist from Bengaluru was attacked with acid on March 18 by three of her theatre colleagues. The accused, identified as Ramesh, Swati and Yogesh, poured acid on the victim thrice while she was lying down on her verandah. The accused said they attacked the victim as Ramesh's wife and children left him because of her.

32.title: EWS admission process in schools in Delhi to begin on March 29
32.article_body: The online application process to get seats in Delhi's private schools under the economically weaker section (EWS)/disadvantaged groups (DG) and children with special needs (CWSN) categories for 2022-2023 will begin on March 29. Applications for these seats were supposed to begin online from March 22, according to the earlier schedule issued by the Directorate of Education.

33.title: I was nervous playing against Nadal: Alcaraz on semi-final loss
33.article_body: Carlos Alcaraz, speaking about his semi-final loss against Rafael Nadal at the Indian Wells, said that he was nervous during the match. "In the whole match, I was thinking...I'm playing against Nadal," Alcaraz stated. He further said, "The next time I will play more calmly and more relaxed. If you are playing against [Nadal], you have to be calm."

34.title: 4 illegal brick kilns shut down in Gautam Buddha Nagar
34.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Pollution Control Board (UPPCB) has shut down four brick kilns operating illegally in Gautam Buddha Nagar's Jewar this week. The kilns had started operating again after being shut down in 2020, an official said. "Our team reached the spot and poured water in them in a bid to stop them from operating illegally," the official added.

35.title: Treated Indian Wells semis vs Alcaraz like playing vs a top-8 player: Nadal
35.article_body: Following his semi-final win against world number 19 Carlos Alcaraz in Indian Wells, 21-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal said it was a "good match". He added, "I didn't treat the match like I was facing a young player at all, but rather like I was playing against a top-eight player." Nadal beat 18-year-old Alcaraz 6-4, 4-6, 6-3 on Saturday.

36.title: CISF to install body scanners at airports in Mumbai, Delhi & other cities
36.article_body: The Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) will install body scanners at major airports in the country, including Delhi and Mumbai. A trial run of body scanners was conducted at several airports, including Delhi, Bangalore, Cochin, Hyderabad, Pune and Chennai, but they observed some shortcomings, officials said. The CISF has decided to adopt the millimetre wave technology, officials added.

37.title: Hope it's start of something amazing: Pooran on joining SRH ahead of IPL
37.article_body: On joining SRH's squad ahead of upcoming IPL 2022, wicketkeeper-batter Nicholas Pooran, who was bought by the franchise for ₹10.75 crore, said he hopes it's the start of something amazing. "I've had a chat with the coaches and Brian Lara [head coach] a bit...he (Brian) is one of the best batsmen in the world that I've ever seen," he added.

38.title: Witness in Dabholkar murder case identifies 2 shooters in Pune court
38.article_body: An eye-witness in the Narendra Dabholkar murder case on Saturday identified two alleged shooters in a Pune court that is overseeing the trial, an official said. Kiran Kamble, after finishing work, heard a "sound like a firecracker burst," said Public Prosecutor Prakash Suryavanshi. When he looked in the direction from where the sound came, he saw two people shoot someone.

39.title: Condom sales surge in Russia amid Western sanctions & fear of shortage
39.article_body: Amid Western sanctions and fear of shortage, sales for condoms have surged in Russia. The country’s largest online retailer Wildberries saw condom sales surging 170% in the first two weeks of March as compared with last year. Pharmacy chain 36.6 also reported a 26% jump in its sales. Meanwhile, a government official said a shortage of this product isn't expected.

40.title: Cooperating with authorities: Infra.Market after ₹224 cr undisclosed income detected
40.article_body: Infra.Market Founder Souvik Sengupta on Sunday said that they are cooperating with the authorities to provide them with the necessary information to solve the issues they have in relation to the recent searches. The Income Tax department has found an undisclosed income of ₹224 crore from the Maharashtra-based unicorn startup group and has seized unaccounted cash worth ₹1 crore.

41.title: Rachakonda Police bust prostitution racket, detain 2 under PD Act
41.article_body: Rachakonda Police invoked the Preventive Detention (PD) Act on Saturday against two offenders for allegedly running a prostitution racket in Hyderabad's Shivaji Nagar area. The accused, identified as Vanarula Sai Kishore and Vanarula Bhavani, were caught along with four others following a raid on Tuesday. Three women, who hailed from Andhra Pradesh, were also rescued from the premises.

42.title: Drunk man calls police 6 times to complain about wife not cooking mutton in T'gana
42.article_body: A man in Telangana dialled 100 six times on Holi to complain about his wife refusing to cook mutton after which he was arrested, police said. Naveen of Cherla Gowraram village in Kanagal made the calls after getting drunk. Police initially dismissed his calls as a prank but decided to take action after repeated calls from Naveen.

43.title: It's gut-wrenching: NZ's Amy Satterthwaite on one-wicket loss vs Eng
43.article_body: Talking about New Zealand's one-wicket loss to England in the Women's ODI World Cup, New Zealand's Amy Satterthwaite said, "It's pretty gut-wrenching to get that close...and feel like you're standing on the edge of the cliff." "It's never...nice position to be in when you're relying on other results...today, we felt like we still had it in our control," she added.

44.title: He's in form at the moment: KKR's Cummins on captain Shreyas ahead of IPL
44.article_body: Talking about KKR captain Shreyas Iyer, teammate Pat Cummins said he's a calm guy and seems "in form" at the moment. Cummins recalled sharing the dressing room with Shreyas during IPL 2017. "Shreyas, I played with at Delhi (Daredevils), we got on really well," he added. Cummins was bought back by KKR for ₹7.25 crore at IPL mega auction 2022.

45.title: N Korea fires multiple rocket launcher shots into sea: S Korea
45.article_body: North Korea has fired multiple rocket launcher shots into the sea on Sunday, South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff said in a statement. "Our military was monitoring the related situation and maintaining a readiness posture," it added. Notably, this comes amid heightened military tensions after a spate of missile launches by North Korea since January.

46.title: Man beaten to death for not giving money to buy liquor in Mumbai
46.article_body: Eight people have been arrested for allegedly killing a man in Mumbai's Versova after he refused to give them money for liquor. The victim was on the way to his home when a person, who knew him, along with his colleagues stopped him and demanded money. A heated argument broke out and the accused hit him with bamboo sticks.

47.title: Covishield dose gap can be reduced to 8-16 weeks from 12-16 weeks: Expert body
47.article_body: India's top expert body on immunisation NTAGI has recommended reducing the gap between the first and second Covishield vaccine doses to between eight and 16 weeks, as per reports. Currently, the second vaccine dose is administered between 12 and 16 weeks after the first. No change has been suggested in the dose gap of Covaxin, PTI reported.

48.title: Bengaluru pitch used for India-Sri Lanka Test rated below average by ICC, venue penalised
48.article_body: The pitch used for India-Sri Lanka Day-Night Test at M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru has been rated below average by ICC. Consequently, the venue has received one demerit point. ICC match referee Javagal Srinath said, "Pitch offered a lot of turn on first day itself and though it improved with every session...it wasn't an even contest between bat and ball."

49.title: Nadal beats 18-yr-old compatriot Alcaraz to enter Indian Wells final
49.article_body: Rafael Nadal defeated 18-year-old Carlos Alcaraz 6-4, 4-6, 6-3 in the all-Spanish clash to enter the singles final of the Indian Wells. Praising the 19th ranked player's performance, Nadal said, "It was just so difficult to stop him (Alcaraz) with his amazing shots." The 35-year-old Spaniard will meet US' Taylor Fritz in his fifth Indian Wells final on Sunday.

50.title: Merger of LJD with RJD was demand of people: Tejashwi Yadav
50.article_body: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav welcomed the move of Sharad Yadav-led Loktantrik Janata Dal (LJD) to merge with his party on Sunday. The Bihar Assembly's Leader of Opposition said, "The decision (merging of LJD into RJD) taken by Sharad Yadav was the demand of the people." Tejashwi also made calls for a united opposition front to defeat BJP.

51.title: Pics show people playing drum on open truck on Mumbai-Pune expressway
51.article_body: Pictures surfaced online show a group of people playing a drum on an open truck on the Mumbai-Pune expressway. The men were seen standing on the truck, which was also carrying two-wheelers. People reacted to the pictures on Twitter. "Goods carrier has become a public carrier, it seems!" a user wrote.

52.title: Yemen's Houthis fire drone, missiles at Saudi facilities, none hurt
52.article_body: Yemen's Houthi rebels on Sunday launched multiple drone and missile strikes on key facilities including natural gas and desalination plants in Saudi Arabia, reported Saudi's state-run media. The attacks did not cause casualties or injuries but damaged civilian vehicles and homes. As per Saudi-led military coalition, strikes also targeted an Aramco oil facility in Jizan along with other facilities.

53.title: Apple ex-employee charged with defrauding company out of $10 mn in US
53.article_body: Dhirendra Prasad, a former Apple employee, has been charged with defrauding the tech giant out of more than $10 million in the US. The 52-year-old worked for 10 years as a buyer in Apple's Global Service Supply Chain department. According to the federal prosecutors, Prasad exploited his position to defraud Apple by allegedly taking kickbacks, stealing equipment and laundering money.

54.title: 8,500 chicken charred to death as fire breaks out at poultry farm in Tamil Nadu
54.article_body: Around 8,500 chicken and chicks were charred in a fire that broke out at a poultry farm in Tamil Nadu's Annur, police said on Sunday. It took the fire and rescue service personnel two hours to extinguish the blaze. Some equipment and poultry feed also got burnt in the fire, resulting in an estimated loss of ₹12 lakh, police added.

55.title: Putin wears Italian jacket worth ₹10 lakh at a rally amid Western sanctions
55.article_body: Amid sanctions by the West, Russian President Vladimir Putin wore a blue jacket made by an Italian brand, Loro Piana, priced at 1.5 million roubles (over ₹10 lakh), at a rally while justifying the Ukraine war. As per a report, in 2021, the average Russian's annual salary was 678,000 roubles, less than half the cost of Putin's jacket.

56.title: Thought Ronaldo would stay in the club: Juventus CEO Arrivabene
56.article_body: Recalling Cristiano Ronaldo's transfer in 2021, Juventus CEO Maurizio Arrivabene has said that he thought the Portuguese footballer would stay in the club. "I saw a motivated Ronaldo on the first days of the pre-season...but then he took a different decision and we know what happened," he added. Ronaldo joined Premier League club Manchester United last year.

57.title: No governance in Bihar but circus without ringmaster: Manoj Jha
57.article_body: RJD leader Manoj Kumar Jha said there is no governance in Bihar but a "circus" and that too without a "ringmaster". The people of Bihar are suffering in the ongoing circus, he added. Jha alleged that the Bihar government has lost credibility amongst the people and the administrative officers are not under the control of the government.

58.title: Elephant tramples 10-yr-old girl to death in Chhattisgarh; 3 escape
58.article_body: A 10-year-old girl was trampled to death by a wild elephant, while three other children managed to escape in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur on Sunday, officials said. The children had gone to pick flowers when the incident occurred, a forest officer said. Forest officials had warned villagers about a herd of elephants, but the children had ignored the warning, the officer added.

59.title: Hyd Police apprehend 3 for drug smuggling, use; seize LSD blots
59.article_body: Three people, including two drug peddlers, were apprehended by Hyderabad's Banjara Hills Police, police said on Saturday. Police caught peddlers while they were supplying narcotics to a person at a city hotel after receiving a tip-off. A total of four lysergic acid diethylamide (LSD) blots, sourced from Goa, and phones, all worth ₹16,000 were seized from accused, police added.

60.title: Seven humanitarian corridors would open on Sunday: Ukraine Deputy PM
60.article_body: Ukrainian Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk said seven humanitarian corridors to enable civilians to leave frontline regions would open on Sunday, March 20. Ukraine has evacuated 190,000 people from such areas since the Russian invasion began on February 24, added Vereshchuk. Meanwhile, UN said at least 847 civilians were killed from February 24 to March 18.

61.title: N Biren Singh to be Chief Minister of Manipur for 2nd time: BJP
61.article_body: N Biren Singh is going to be the Chief Minister of Manipur for the second time, the BJP announced on Sunday. Singh was unanimously elected as the CM in the Manipur BJP legislature party meeting in Imphal. BJP's announcement comes 10 days after the party won 32 out of 60 Assembly seats in Manipur.

62.title: I love to see 150 kmph being clocked on the big screen: Meredith
62.article_body: Australia fast bowler Riley Meredith, in an introduction video posted by Mumbai Indians' official YouTube channel, said, "I love to see 150 kmph being clocked on the big screen." Meredith stated that bouncer is his favorite delivery. The 25-year-old, who previously played for Punjab Kings, was bought by Mumbai Indians in the IPL 2022 mega auction for ₹1 crore.

63.title: There's big potential in RR to win the IPL 2022: Shimron Hetmyer
63.article_body: Rajasthan Royals batter Shimron Hetmyer opined that his franchise has the potential to win the IPL this year. Hetmyer, who has previously played for Delhi Capitals, was bought by Rajasthan Royals for ₹8.5 crore in the mega auction. "There's no pressure of the price tag on me, it's a challenge to help the Royals when I'm out there," he added.

64.title: Microbes, minerals may have set off Earth's oxygenation: US study
64.article_body: US researchers stated that microbes and minerals may have triggered Earth's oxygenation. The team proposed a hypothesis which suggested that oxygen started accumulating in the atmosphere due to interaction between some marine microbes and minerals that are found in ocean sediments. Scientists added that these interactions prevented oxygen from being consumed setting off a self-amplifying process.

65.title: ISRO plans to increase number of launches, satellite manufacturing
65.article_body: ISRO Chairman S Somanath said the agency plans to increase the number of launches and satellite manufacturing. "ISRO is looking at the important tasks that can be done this year..." added Somanath. According to him, ISRO will look at increasing space missions with the Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle (PSLV), Geosynchronous Satellite Launch Vehicle (GSLV) and Small Satellite Launch Vehicle (SSLV).

66.title: Suzuki to invest ₹10,440 cr to make electric vehicles, batteries in Gujarat
66.article_body: Japan's Suzuki Motor Corporation has announced plans to invest around ₹10,440 crore to locally manufacture electric vehicles (BEV) and BEV batteries in Gujarat. The memorandum of understanding was signed at India-Japan Economic Forum in the presence of PM Narendra Modi and Japanese PM Fumio Kishida. "We'll continue active investment in India to realise Atmanirbhar Bharat," Suzuki's President said.

67.title: Man catches 10.5-ft-long 'living dinosaur' fish said to be over 100 yrs old in Canada
67.article_body: A fisherman caught a 10.5-foot-long sturgeon fish, also known as the 'living dinosaur', in a river in Canada's British Columbia. A now-viral video has shown fisherman Yves Bisson releasing the giant fish weighing over 500 pounds (over 226 kg) back into the river after tagging it. Bisson said the fish could be over 100 years old.

68.title: Dad didn't teach me acting; never brought things related to films at home: Ram
68.article_body: Actor Ram Charan revealed that even though he hails from a film family, nothing related to movies was brought home during his childhood. "It was always confined to office. There was no trace of films for me," he said. Ram further added that even when he was starting off his career, his father Chiranjeevi never told him how to act.

69.title: Had to create sane lunatic to compete with mad hero: Ethan on Moon Knight
69.article_body: Actor Ethan Hawke, who stars opposite Oscar Isaac as villain Arthur Harrow in the upcoming Marvel show 'Moon Knight', has said he had to "create a very sane lunatic to compete with the mad hero". "In our story, hero is struggling with mental illness and it created a real problem for me because...antagonist has to be something else," he added.

70.title: Spinners need to learn to perform in all conditions: Saeed Ajmal
70.article_body: Talking about flat pitches used in Rawalpindi and Karachi in the first two Pakistan-Australia Tests, ex-Pakistan spinner Saeed Ajmal said spinners need to learn to perform in all conditions. "If you want to complain about 'flat pitches'...you should quit cricket," he added. This comes as Pakistan spinner Nauman Ali is the leading wicket-taker in the ongoing series with seven wickets.

71.title: Police should give security for matches after recovering dues from MCA: Activist
71.article_body: An RTI activist, Anil Galgali, has written to Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey urging him to provide security for cricket matches only after recovering dues from the Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA). Galgali alleged that the MCA has not paid dues worth ₹14.82 crore to the Mumbai Police in the past eight years even after receiving 35 reminders of recovery.

72.title: B'luru Police share road safety post, say 'Helmet, belts will keep safe'
72.article_body: Bengaluru Police took to Twitter to share a post on road safety. "Seat belts and helmets are mandatory when you are driving, which will keep you safe. Be responsible and follow the road safety rules and model for minors," the tweet read. The post also showed a graphic presentation of using seat belts and helmets.

73.title: BJP's Kirit Somaiya alleges ₹1,000 cr scam by Shiv Sena leaders in Mumbai
73.article_body: BJP leader Kirit Somaiya claimed of exposing ₹1,000 crore scam alleging that Shiv Sena leader Yashwant Jadhav and his wife, an MLA, Yamini Yashwant bought 36 old buildings in Mumbai in the past two years. "₹1,000 crore scam exposed, I am confident of actions by ED, Company Ministry, Income Tax Department in next few days," the BJP leader tweeted.

74.title: What's the controversy around release of 'The Kashmir Files' in New Zealand?
74.article_body: The release of 'The Kashmir Files' has been put on hold in New Zealand after its censor board decided to review the movie's classification. This came after members of the Muslim community in New Zealand raised concerns about the film, which was earlier cleared for audiences above the age of 16. The community alleged the movie could raise 'anti-Muslim sentiments'.

75.title: Showing 'The Kashmir...' for free in park is criminal offence: Vivek on Haryana poster
75.article_body: Director Vivek Agnihotri took to Twitter to share a poster from Haryana's Rewari wherein BJP leaders invited people for free screening of 'The Kashmir Files' in a park. Vivek wrote, "Showing 'The Kashmir Files' like this in open and free is a criminal offence. Dear @mlkhattar ji...I’d request you to stop this." He added, "Political leaders must respect creative business."

76.title: Couldn't find financer; considered releasing 'The Kashmir...' on YouTube: Vivek
76.article_body: Recently at a press conference, director Vivek Agnihotri spoke about the hurdles he faced before starting the shooting of 'The Kashmir Files'. He said, "Film begins with an idea...But in our case, there was no material." "Another problem was to find a financer. We hadn't even thought that we'd make a feature film...We had...considered releasing it on YouTube," he said.

77.title: Rubina is more successful, she's doing more work than I am: Abhinav
77.article_body: Actor Abhinav Shukla said in an interview that his actress-wife Rubina Dilaik is a bigger star than him. "I know she's more successful than me...She's doing more work than I am, that's a fact," he added. "We've to be practical about it. It is what it is...Somebody would be a fool who doesn't admit she's more successful," Abhinav further said.

78.title: Excited to work with Sangakkara, Malinga and Boult: RR's Saini
78.article_body: Pacer Navdeep Saini, who was bought by RR for ₹2.6 crore in the IPL mega auction, has said he's excited to work with Kumar Sangakkara and Lasith Malinga and play alongside Trent Boult in the upcoming season. "I'm coming into this season on the back of a lot of hard work," he stated. Saini played only two matches last season.

79.title: AC Milan players racially abused by crowd: Manager Stefano Pioli
79.article_body: AC Milan goalkeeper Mike Maignan and defender Fikayo Tomori were racially abused by Cagliari club supporters during their 1-0 Serie A win on Saturday, manager Stefano Pioli said. "Mike told me it was possible to hear some insults from behind the goal...Tomori also told me the same thing," Pioli added. However, Cagliari's Joao Pedro denied hearing any racist comments.

80.title: Very important day: Karthik on 8-ball 29* in 2018 Nidahas Trophy final
80.article_body: Recalling his match-winning knock of 8-ball 29* in 2018 Nidahas Trophy final against Bangladesh, India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said, "It's a very important day in my life." He added, "Two overs and 34 runs- as a batter you're thinking 'how many boundaries can I hit?'" With five needed off final delivery, he hit a six. India won by four wickets.

81.title: 6 killed, dozens injured as car rams into carnival crowd in Belgium
81.article_body: At least six people, including a child, were killed and over 30 were injured after a car rammed into a crowd that had gathered to attend a carnival in Belgium's Strepy-Bracquegnies. "The driver was intercepted as he tried to get away," said the mayor of the neighbouring town La Louviere. It was not immediately known if the incident was intentional.

82.title: Australia to provide temporary visas to refugees from Ukraine
82.article_body: Australia will issue temporary humanitarian visas to refugees from Ukraine, enabling them to study, work and access medicare in the country for up to three years, Australian government has said. About 4,500 visas have been issued to Ukrainians since the Russian invasion, it added. Additionally, the government has provided a grant of AUD$ 450,000 to local communities to assist refugees.

83.title: US pair of Jack Sock, John Isner win men's doubles title at Indian Wells
83.article_body: The American pair of Jack Sock and John Isner won the men's doubles title at the Indian Wells on Saturday. The pair defeated Santiago Gonzalez and Edouard Roger-Vasselin in straight sets 7-6(7-4), 6-3. Notably, the women's doubles title was won by the Chinese pair of Xu Yifan and Yang Zhaoxuan who also defeated their opponents in straight sets.

84.title: Ukrainian woman saves one-month-old daughter from shelling, pic from hospital goes viral
84.article_body: A woman in Ukraine saved her one-month-old daughter from Russian shelling by covering the baby with her body. The woman herself received numerous injuries after which she was taken to the Okhmatdyt Children's Hospital. A picture of the woman with her daughter from the hospital has gone viral on social media.

85.title: Ajith to team up with Vignesh Shivan for his next, film to release in 2023
85.article_body: Ajith Kumar is set to collaborate with filmmaker Vignesh Shivan for his next film, which has been tentatively titled 'AK 62'. The upcoming project will be bankrolled by Lyca Productions. "The shooting of the film will commence by the end of this year and release by mid next year. The other...details will be announced soon," Lyca said in a statement.

86.title: Mahatma Gandhi biggest Hindu and secularist: Ghulam Nabi Azad
86.article_body: Senior Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad on Sunday hailed Mahatma Gandhi as the "biggest Hindu and secularist". Speaking at an event in Jammu, Azad further said that political parties, be it regional or national, divide people on the basis of religion, caste and other things. "Justice must be given to everyone irrespective of caste and religion," he added.

87.title: Man carrying ₹25,000 bounty arrested in Noida's Sector 62
87.article_body: A man carrying a ₹25,000 bounty for his alleged involvement in smuggling of cow meat has been arrested in Noida's Sector 62 after a firefight with the police on Thursday. "We recovered from his possession a bag that contained tools used to slaughter animals," a police officer said. A country-made pistol and four live cartridges were also recovered, he added.

88.title: It's not about wickets, it about how you play: Akhtar recalls chat with Warne
88.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said he once asked Shane Warne if his career would be defined by the number of wickets he has taken. "Warne said, 'No Shoaib, people remember how you play the cricket...It's not how many wickets you've taken, it's the way you played the game'," recalled Akhtar. Warne died of a heart attack earlier this month.

89.title: Telangana's veteran CPI(M) leader Mallu Swarajyam passes away at 91
89.article_body: Telangana's veteran communist leader Mallu Swarajyam passed away due to multiple organ failures in Hyderabad on Saturday. The 91-year-old CPI(M) member participated in the Telangana People's Armed Struggle (1946-51) against feudal lords and Razakars during the Nizam rule. As a candidate of CPI(M), she was elected to the state Assembly of undivided Andhra Pradesh for two terms (1978 and 1983).

90.title: 3 Haryana women killed as jeep overturns while trying to save animal
90.article_body: At least three women were killed and 11 injured after the pickup jeep in which they were travelling overturned in Hisar district of Haryana on Saturday, police said. The accident occurred after a stray animal came in front of their jeep. The driver tried to avoid hitting the animal and lost control of the jeep.

91.title: Hoping B'wood doesn't make any more remakes; don't want to see more: Ananya
91.article_body: In a recent interview, actress Ananya Panday said that she hopes there aren't any more remakes in Bollywood. "I'm really happy with this. This path that we're going down is where we're kind of telling an original, braver, complex story," she added. "So, I'm kind of in that phase where I don't really want to see more remakes," Ananya said.

92.title: 45-yr-old man kills wife's lover in TN after learning about their affair; held
92.article_body: A 45-year-old man in Tamil Nadu's 15 Velampalayam allegedly killed his wife's lover after learning about their affair and following the murder, the accused was arrested by the police on Saturday. The deceased man was staying at a rented accommodation. His wife died a few years ago and he was staying along with his two sons, mother and younger brother.

93.title: Had an orgasm while watching Jaideep Ahlawat in Paatal Lok: Zeeshan Ayyub
93.article_body: In a recent interview, actor Mohammed Zeeshan Ayyub spoke about his favourite characters of his co-star Jaideep Ahlawat. Zeeshan said he almost had an "orgasm" after watching him in 'Paatal Lok'. When Jaideep was asked the same question, he said Zeeshan's character from 'Raanjhanaa' is his favourite. "I was in love with him in 'Raanjhanaa' as Pandit Ji," he added.

94.title: Labourers attacked with glass bottles for playing Bhojpuri music on Holi
94.article_body: A group of labourers from Bihar was allegedly attacked with glass bottles by a group of around eight to 10 youths at a factory in Haryana's Raipur Rani for playing Bhojpuri songs during a DJ party on Holi. One of the victims alleged that the accused told the DJ to play Punjabi music. Police have arrested two persons so far.

95.title: Portion of Ludhiana road caves in due to water leakage, area barricaded
95.article_body: A one-foot long portion of a road in Punjab's Ludhiana caved in on Saturday. Municipal Corporation officials said that there was leakage in one of the water supply connections due to which sand might have eroded leading to the road to cave in. Police installed a barricade around the damaged site. No accidents were reported.

96.title: Russia bombs Mariupol art school that was housing 400 residents: Ukraine
96.article_body: Russian forces on Saturday bombed an art school where around 400 residents were taking shelter, said Mariupol city council. As per the local authorities, the school’s building was destroyed and people could be under the rubble. As of now, there is no confirmation of casualties. Earlier, Russian forces bombed a theatre in Mariupol where civilians were sheltering.

97.title: Bee attack killed man in custody: Bihar Police after mob kills ASI, sets station on fire
97.article_body: After a mob allegedly set fire to a police station in Bihar and killed an assistant sub-inspector (ASI) over an alleged custodial death of a villager, Bettiah SP UN Verma claimed the man died after being attacked by bees. Verma said the incident took place when the deceased was drinking water from a hand pump on the police station premises.

98.title: Shane Warne given lap of honour at private funeral in Melbourne, pics surface
98.article_body: Shane Warne's family and friends bid the cricketing legend farewell at a private funeral in Melbourne on Sunday. Warne's three children and parents were joined by around 80 guests, including Michael Clarke and Michael Vaughan, at the service. Warne was given a lap of honour at St Kilda's home ground with Coldplay's 'Fix You' playing in the background.

99.title: Speeding auto overturns as youths throw water balloons at it in UP, video surfaces
99.article_body: An autorickshaw met with an accident after being struck by water balloons hurled at it by local youths in UP's Baghpat. A video of the incident shows the auto, that was moving at high speed, overturning after being hit by water balloons on Holi. At least two people along with the auto driver were injured in the incident.

100.title: World Bank to give ₹7 cr to build modernised slaughterhouse in Pune
100.article_body: The World Bank will give the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) ₹7 crore to construct a modernised slaughterhouse in the city, officials have said. This project will help citizens in getting good quality meat and stop the illegal slaughter of animals, Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar said. A PMC Veterinary Officer said that the civic body-owned Kondhwa slaughterhouse will also be upgraded.

101.title: Jennifer Lopez, Affleck to buy estate with 10 bedrooms, 17 bathrooms for $50 million: Reports
101.article_body: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck are buying an estate worth $50 million in the Bel-Air area of Los Angeles, as per reports. The estate is spread across 20,000 square feet and has 10 bedrooms, 17 bathrooms, multiple kitchens, a theatre and gym among other things, reports added. The house is super private, surrounded by trees, reports further said.

102.title: Poland begins issuing identification cards to Ukraine refugees
102.article_body: Over 1,23,000 personal identification number (PESEL) cards have been distributed to refugees from Ukraine in Poland since Wednesday, Polish authorities have confirmed. These cards will enable refugees to reside, study, work, avail medical and social benefits in Poland for the next 18 months. Poland has taken in over 2 million refugees from Ukraine since the Russian invasion last month.

103.title: We need to focus on what we need to get ready for 1st game: DC coach Ponting
103.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting has said he's focusing on what they need to get ready for their match of IPL 2022. He added, "I had a great first session with the players. There's an energetic vibe around the team." Ponting further said, "I'm going to have breakfast, lunch and dinner with all the younger guys that I don't know."

104.title: Gurugram authorities to remove encroachments along 2.2-km long road
104.article_body: The Haryana Shehri Vikas Pradhikaran (HSVP) will carry out an anti-encroachment drive along a 2.2-kilometre long road between Hero Honda Chowk and Umang Bhardwaj Chowk in Gurugram from Monday. The drive is being carried out ahead of the expansion of the road in the area. The support of the police for demolishing the encroachments has been sought, the HSVP said.

105.title: Bengaluru Police arrests 2 from TN for threats to hijab case judges
105.article_body: Bengaluru Police has arrested two persons for allegedly issuing threats to the special bench judges of the Karnataka HC who upheld the hijab ban in the state's educational institutions. The arrests were made on Saturday night and the accused are office bearers of the Tamil Nadu Thowheed Jamath. The state has now announced 'Y' category security for the three judges.

106.title: Inspect sites in 1st half of working days: Delhi PWD to officials
106.article_body: Delhi's Public Works Department (PWD) has asked its officials to devote first half of all working days to site inspection to ensure construction projects are completed on time. PWD also asked officials to submit brief field inspection reports to the Superintending Engineer on a daily basis. Officials will have to submit on-site photographs to the Engineer-in-Chief every day, it added.

107.title: Kajol gets body-shamed by trolls for her outfit; fans react, 'Let her live'
107.article_body: Actress Kajol Devgan recently attended film producer Apoorva Mehta's 50th birthday in Mumbai. For the occasion, the actress wore a black bodycon dress, while many appreciated her choice, some trolls body-shamed her. A user commented on the video, "Omg is she pregnant?" Defending the actress, one of her fans wrote, "She's healthy and looks her age. Just let her live."

108.title: You'll have to work 30 hours a day: Kejriwal to Punjab MLAs
108.article_body: AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Sunday told Punjab MLAs to work hard and fulfil targets set by Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann. "A day of 24 hours won't be enough. You'll have to work 30 hours a day," Kejriwal said. "If you don't meet the targets, then people will say change the minister...[then] we'll have no option," he added.

109.title: He was one of the best ever for India: GT's Dayal on head coach Nehra
109.article_body: GT pacer Yash Dayal said having Ashish Nehra as head coach is great for the franchise as he has seen it all as a player and a coach in IPL. "As a left-arm fast bowler, he [Nehra] was one of the best ever for India," he added. The 24-year-old left-arm pacer will be making his IPL debut in upcoming season.

110.title: Bhopal jail prisoners get training to become priests, being taught rituals
110.article_body: Training for becoming priests is being given to 50 prisoners of the Bhopal Central Jail. They are also taking lessons on performing various Vedic rituals. "We are training these prisoners as they are cloistered from society...They are being taught rituals so that they can work for well-being of people," a member of the institute providing training to the prisoners said.

111.title: Grandfather, brother held for rape of 11-year-old Pune girl; search on for father, uncle
111.article_body: Pune police investigating a case of alleged rape and sexual abuse of an 11-year-old girl by four of her family members have arrested her grandfather and detained her 14-year-old brother. Teams have been dispatched for the arrest of her father and uncle, police added. An FIR in the case was registered based on a complaint filed by a school counsellor.

112.title: Govt working on classification of cryptos under GST law: Report
112.article_body: The government is reportedly working on the classification of cryptocurrencies as goods or services under the GST law. "There's a clarity needed in regard to levy of GST on cryptocurrencies and whether it has to be levied on the entire value," an official told PTI. Currently, the government levies 18% GST on the services provided by the crypto exchanges.

113.title: Fired cruise missiles on Ukraine from Black Sea, Caspian Sea: Russia
113.article_body: Russia has said that it carried out strikes on Ukraine using cruise missiles launched from ships in the Black Sea and Caspian Sea and hypersonic missiles from Crimean airspace. It was done to destroy a fuel storage facility the Ukrainian military was using, said the Russian Defence Ministry. The Russians also struck a Ukrainian military preparation centre.

114.title: 2 arrested for allegedly smuggling 2 tonnes beef worth ₹6 lakh in Pune
114.article_body: Two people were arrested for allegedly smuggling two tonnes of beef worth ₹6 lakh in the Pimpri-Chinchwad area of Pune district, a police official said. The seizure was made from a truck during checking late Friday night, he added. The accused have been charged under the Indian Penal Code and Maharashtra Animal Preservation Act provisions, the official further said.

115.title: Girls are gutted, we have lost 3 games in WC by 2-3 wickets or few runs: Devine
115.article_body: NZ captain Sophie Devine has said girls are gutted after their one-wicket defeat against England in the Women's ODI World Cup. "We have lost three games by 2-3 wickets or a few runs...the hard thing is we could've done a lot of things differently," she added. NZ are placed sixth on the points table with two wins in six games.

116.title: Kashmir Files earns ₹24 cr on Sat, Akshay's 'Bachchhan...' collects ₹12 cr
116.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' collected ₹24.8 crore in India on Saturday. Meanwhile, Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Bachchhan Paandey', which was released in theatres on Friday, witnessed a dip in its collection by earning ₹12 crore on day two. As per film trade analyst Taran Adarsh, the action-comedy film, directed by Farhad Samji, had begun its box office journey with ₹13.25 crore.

117.title: ABVP ex-chief, accused of peeing at elderly widow’s doorstep, arrested
117.article_body: Former ABVP national president Dr Subbiah Shanmugam was arrested on Saturday for allegedly harassing a 62-year-old widow back in July 2020 in Chennai. He is accused of urinating and throwing garbage including used surgical masks at her doorstep over a disagreement related to parking space use. Shanmugam, a medical college professor, was suspended from service recently, said police.

118.title: Censoring 'The Kashmir Files' is an attack on our freedom: Ex-New Zealand Dy PM
118.article_body: New Zealand's former Deputy Prime Minister Winston Peters has sought the release of 'The Kashmir Files' in his country saying that censoring it would be an "attack" on freedom of New Zealanders. "The film is about true and real events...To censor this film is tantamount to...removing from public knowledge all images of the attack on 9/11," said Peters.

119.title: KKR's Tim Southee marries longtime girlfriend ahead of IPL 2022, shares pic
119.article_body: Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) fast bowler Tim Southee got married to his longtime girlfriend Brya ahead of IPL 2022. Southee took to Instagram to share a picture from the wedding, writing, "Forever." The couple have two daughters together, Indie May Southee and Sloane Ava Southee, who were born in 2017 and 2019 respectively.

120.title: So influenced by looks: Mira on tweet criticising Ukrainian President's outfit
120.article_body: Shahid Kapoor's wife Mira Rajput defended Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and criticised US financial expert Peter Schiff's tweet questioning his outfit. Peter had tweeted, "Times are hard, but doesn't the President of...Ukraine own a suit?" Reacting to it, she wrote, "You'd ask him to wear cufflinks if you could...Seriously! Are we getting so influenced by looks...that we forget reality."

121.title: Man stabs 25-yr-old man as car hits two-wheeler in Ahmedabad
121.article_body: A 25-year-old man, Deepak Thakore, was stabbed by another man, Kunal Shah, who asked him to "drive properly" after the latter's car hit Deepak's two-wheeler. Reports said that Kunal and his parents reached Deepak's house, where Kunal abused Deepak and threatened to kill him. Deepak asked Kunal to leave, following which, Kunal stabbed Deepak.

122.title: Saudi Aramco's net profit more than doubles to $110 billion in 2021
122.article_body: Oil giant Saudi Aramco on Sunday reported that its annual net profit for 2021 has more than doubled amid soaring crude oil prices. Aramco said its net profit increased by 124% to $110 billion in 2021, compared to $49 billion in 2020. The company has further announced that it plans to boost its capital expenditure to $40-$50 billion this year.

123.title: Uttarakhand MLAs to take oath tomorrow: BJP state chief
123.article_body: Uttarakhand BJP head Madan Kaushik has claimed that all newly elected members of the state Legislative Assembly will take oath on Monday. "All newly elected members...will take oath at 11 am in Vidhan Sabha tomorrow," said Kaushik. He further informed that the state's CM will be announced after the meeting of the Legislative Party in the evening.

124.title: ₹224 cr undisclosed income found during raids on Maharashtra-based unicorn
124.article_body: The Income Tax department found an undisclosed income of about ₹224 crore after it raided a unicorn startup based in Pune and Thane in Maharashtra. While the firm is engaged in wholesale and retail of construction materials, the Central Board of Direct Taxes said that its annual turnover exceeded ₹6,000 crore. Unaccounted cash worth ₹1 crore has also been seized.

125.title: Whole country is talking about Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann & his works: Kejriwal
125.article_body: AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal addressed Punjab AAP MLAs on Sunday and said that the whole country is talking about CM Bhagwant Mann and his works. "Compensation for crops damaged in October has been released and farmers will get cheques in the coming days. You have done good work within three days of forming the government," Kejriwal added.

126.title: 'People know where he goes for walk', K'taka HC Chief Justice gets death threat
126.article_body: An advocate has filed a case over a video of a man threatening to kill Karnataka High Court Chief Justice Ritu Raj Awasthi over hijab ban verdict. He said the man referred to the alleged murder of a Jharkhand judge, who was killed on morning walk. The complainant added the man said people know where Chief Justice goes for walk.

127.title: 877 newborns died as women refused hospital delivery during COVID: Meghalaya govt
127.article_body: As many as 877 newborn babies and 61 mothers died as pregnant women refused to get themselves admitted to hospitals for institutional delivery during the COVID-19 pandemic due to fears of contracting the disease, the Meghalaya government told the NHRC. The NHRC had registered a case over the high number of maternal and newborn deaths in the state during pandemic.

128.title: Sharad Yadav merges his LJD party with Lalu's RJD after parting ways 25 yrs ago
128.article_body: Former Union Minister Sharad Yadav on Sunday merged his Loktantrik Janata Dal (LJD) party with Lalu Prasad Yadav-led Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) in Delhi. The two leaders had parted ways 25 years ago. "Merger of our party with RJD is first step towards Opposition unity. It's imperative that whole Opposition gets united across India to defeat BJP," Sharad said.

129.title: Success is built on OTT today, I'd love to explore OTT space: Govinda
129.article_body: Actor Govinda said in an interview that he would love to explore the digital medium. "Times have definitely changed since we started out, and things have evolved to a point where success is built on OTT platforms today," he added. "OTT is a platform for all kinds of artists, and I would...love to explore...OTT space as an actor," said Govinda.

130.title: Ukraine Prez suspends 11 political parties with links to Russia
130.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a video address on Sunday said that activities of 11 political parties with links to Russia have been suspended for the period of martial law amid the conflict between the two countries. The suspended parties included Viktor Medvedchuk-led Opposition Platform for Life. Medvedchuk claims that Russian President Vladimir Putin is his daughter's godfather.

131.title: Kanye barred from performing at Grammys over 'concerning online behaviour'
131.article_body: Rapper Kanye West has been barred from performing at the Grammy Awards 2022 due to his "concerning online behaviour", said his representative. This comes after West's Instagram account was suspended for 24 hours this week for posting racial comments against 'The Daily Show' host Trevor Noah. Earlier, Noah had criticised West for his posts about his ex-wife, Kim Kardashian.

132.title: US is offering rewards of up to $5 million for info on Russian oligarchs' assets
132.article_body: The US government is offering rewards of up to $5 million for anyone who can provide information leading to the seizure of assets belonging to Russian oligarchs. Under the program, assets can include yachts, jets, and properties situated in the US. The government has also provided names of 28 Russians, for which they are interested in receiving information.

133.title: 64-yr-old man dies after branches of banyan tree fall on him in Mumbai
133.article_body: A 64-year-old man died after the branches of a banyan tree fell on him in Mumbai's Matunga Road. "The injured person was...taken to PD Hinduja Hospital, where doctors declared him dead," an official from the control room of BMC's disaster management cell said. The branches also damaged some shops near the restaurant, as per reports.

134.title: Brad Pitt's 'Bullet Train' release postponed, film to release on July 29
134.article_body: The release of Brad Pitt's 'Bullet Train' has been postponed. The film, which was slated to release on July 15, will now hit the screens on July 29, taking the recently-vacated date of Dwayne Johnson's DC film 'Black Adam'. Also starring Sandra Bullock and Aaron Taylor-Johnson, 'Bullet Train' is an action-thriller film directed by David Leitch.

135.title: I still feel it is not in the spirit of the game: Brian Lara on 'mankading' rule change
135.article_body: After MCC announced 'mankading' will be considered a regular run-out and won't be included in 'unfair play' section of rule book, ex-West Indies captain Brian Lara said, "I still feel it is not in the spirit of the game." Earlier, Ravichandran Ashwin had urged bowlers to not have "second thoughts" on running non-strikers out.

136.title: DC share video of their team room in Mumbai
136.article_body: Delhi Capitals took to Instagram to share video of their team room in Mumbai ahead of IPL 2022. The video shows their recreation room wherein one can see table tennis and pool tables, and video games among other things. The video also features a terrace zone. Delhi Capitals will face Mumbai Indians in their IPL 2022 opener on March 27.

137.title: Woman dies after son attacks her with weapon over property dispute in Delhi
137.article_body: A 53-year-old man, Bhagwan Das, was arrested for allegedly attacking his 76-year-old mother with a weapon in Delhi, leading to her death one day later. Police found that the woman's children began hitting each other over property dispute and Das later attacked her. Police said that the woman was unfit to give statement before passing away.

138.title: I'm from Hindi Medium; never faced roadblocks because of my language: Pankaj
138.article_body: When asked if language ever created any obstacle for him in Bollywood, actor Pankaj Tripathi said he's from Hindi medium background and it has been an advantage for him. "I don't think I ever had to face any...roadblocks because of my language," he said. "If you know from where you come from, you're ready to face any problems," he added.

139.title: Ukraine to get US’ Javelin and Stinger missiles within days, says official
139.article_body: Ukraine's National Security official Oleksiy Danilov has said that the country will receive US weapons including Javelin and Stinger missiles to help them fight against the Russian forces. "The (weapons) will be on the territory of our country in the nearest future. We are talking about days," said Danilov. Ukraine has so far received weapon shipments from several countries.

140.title: One of Europe's biggest steel plants in Ukraine damaged by Russia, video surfaces
140.article_body: Azovstal, one of Europe's biggest steel plants, was damaged as Russian forces attacked the Ukrainian port city of Mariupol, officials said. Sharing a video on Twitter, Ukrainian MP Lesia Vasylenko wrote, "The economic losses for #Ukraine are huge. The environment is devastated." "We will return to the city, rebuild the enterprise and revive it," Azovstal Director General Enver Tskitishvili said.

141.title: Carpenter from UP shot at, 3 CRPF personnel injured in grenade attacks in J&K
141.article_body: A carpenter from Uttar Pradesh was shot at and three Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel were injured in two separate grenade attacks by suspected militants in Jammu and Kashmir. The carpenter, who was critically injured, was immediately shifted to SMHS Hospital in Srinagar, where he is undergoing treatment. Police have registered cases in connection with the terror crimes.

142.title: 'The Kashmir Files' won't provide political advantage to anyone: Sanjay Raut
142.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said it is not right to do politics on a sensitive issue like Kashmir. "'The Kashmir Files' is just a film, I don't think it will provide any political advantage to anyone in the coming elections," Raut added ahead of the BMC elections. "By the time elections come, the film will be gone," Raut stated.

143.title: All not well in BJP, says Digambar Kamat on delay in govt formation in Goa
143.article_body: Goa Leader of Opposition Digambar Kamat said that even after a week’s time since the Assembly poll results were declared in Goa, there has been a delay in swearing-in the new government which indicates that "all is not well in BJP". "The people of Goa are deprived of a government to govern the state," Kamat added.

144.title: I can't see the pitch being much different: Cummins on same XI for 3rd Pak Test
144.article_body: Australia have named an unchanged playing XI for the series-deciding third Test against Pakistan, starting on Monday. Talking about it, Australia captain Pat Cummins said, "We were happy with how all 11 players [played in] last Test...[pitch] seems hard, but I can't see it being too much different from the [previous] ones." The first two Tests ended in a draw.

145.title: Every state can think on it: Pralhad on Bhagavad Gita in schools
145.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Saturday reacted to the Gujarat government's decision to introduce the Bhagavad Gita in the school syllabus, saying that every state can think about it.  "Bhagavad Gita teaches us morality and ethics. It shows us the responsibility towards wellbeing of society," he added. He further said that scripture has many moral stories that can inspire students.

146.title: BJP luring 10 Gujarat Congress MLAs, claims Rajasthan CM's adviser
146.article_body: Sanyam Lodha, an adviser to Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot, has claimed that BJP is allegedly trying to lure 10 Gujarat Congress MLAs ahead of the state elections later this year. "Number may eventually be more than 10... I had warned (Congress' Gujarat in charge) Raghu Sharma a month ago but there was no response, so I tweeted," Lodha said.

147.title: Sanctions against Russia over Ukraine outrageous: Chinese minister
147.article_body: Chinese Vice Foreign Minister Le Yucheng on Saturday said the sanctions against Russia over the Ukraine situation "are getting more and more outrageous". He said that the Russian citizens were being deprived of overseas assets for no reason. "The consequences of forcing a major power, especially a nuclear power, into a corner are even more unimaginable," Yucheng added.

148.title: Target is 2024 LS polls, needs more hard work: Mulayam to SP cadre
148.article_body: SP patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav has addressed the party workers by saying that the next "target is 2024" general elections and will require "more hard work and strengthening of the party". Speaking at a Holi gathering in Saifai, Yadav praised the workers for their effort which helped SP in getting its highest vote share ever in the UP Assembly elections.

149.title: Karnataka govt provides 'Y' category security to HC judges who gave hijab verdict
149.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday said that 'Y' category security will be provided to three judges of Karnataka High Court, including Chief Justice Ritu Raj Awasthi, who recently upheld the ban on hijab in educational institutions. This comes after a video of a person threatening to kill Justice Awasthi surfaced online. Three persons have been booked in this connection.

150.title: Around 100 injured as makeshift gallery collapses at football ground in Kerala
150.article_body: Around 100 people are said to be injured after a makeshift gallery collapsed at a football ground in Kerala. The gallery was made of bamboo and areca nut tree slats and collapsed after it couldn't withstand pressure with hundreds of people sitting on it to watch a football match. Several of the injured had broken legs and arms. reports said.

151.title: Rahul gave me bowling, he's my favourite captain: Shreyas Iyer
151.article_body: India batter Shreyas Iyer has praised KL Rahul's captaincy, stating that the 29-year-old has a "very calm demeanour" and his on-field decision making is very "instinctive". Iyer added, "I really enjoyed playing under him. Also, he gave me three overs of bowling [during South Africa ODIs], which none of the captains previously had done. So yeah, he's my favourite captain."

152.title: Baseless allegations made due to Raj polls next yr: Vaibhav Gehlot
152.article_body: President of the Rajasthan Cricket Association Vaibhav Gehlot has dismissed the allegations levelled at him of duping a Nashik resident. "Rajasthan Assembly polls (are) scheduled to be held next year. So, these kinds of baseless allegations will be levelled at me," said Gehlot. The FIR was lodged against 16 people, including Gehlot, at the Gangapur Police Station in Nashik.

153.title: US man wrongfully jailed for 23 years seeks $93 million in lawsuit
153.article_body: A 45-year-old man from US' Kansas has filed a lawsuit seeking $93 million (over ₹706 crore) in damages after he was wrongfully convicted for double murder. Lamonte McIntyre and his mother claimed that a detective coerced her into sex and then framed him for murder after she rejected the detective's sexual advances later. McIntyre had served 23 years in jail.

154.title: Multiple explosions at Pakistan military base spark massive fire, video surfaces
154.article_body: A massive explosion occurred in the northern Pakistani city of Sialkot on Sunday, ANI reported. Rishi Suri, editor of The Daily Milap, said that multiple explosions took place at the Sialkot military base in northern Pakistan. He said in a tweet, "Initial indications are this is an ammunition storage area. A large fire is burning. Cause as yet unverified."

155.title: Unfortunate that Congress didn't call it a genocide: Anupam on 'The Kashmir...'
155.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher, who starred in 'The Kashmir Files', reacted to the Congress' remark wherein they said that the Kashmiri Hindus cannot be classified as "internally displaced persons". He said, "It is unfortunate that the ruling government of that time did not think of protecting or of not calling it a genocide." "It is a genocide...It's not fiction," he added.

156.title: Bhagavad Gita in textbooks will improve kids' intelligence level: Bommai
156.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that if Bhagavad Gita is incorporated in textbooks, it will improve the intelligence level among children. "What is wrong with it? The education department is also making preparations to introduce it in our state. Let them give their report first. We will then decide in this regard," he added.

157.title: SC issues notice on daughters’ plea to trace 89-year-old mother
157.article_body: The Supreme Court issued notice on a petition filed by two daughters seeking their mother’s whereabouts, a resident of Bihar’s Muzaffarpur. The 89-year-old woman was brought to Delhi’s Ganga Ram hospital for treatment in February, 2022 but remained untraced after February 26 when she was moved to an undisclosed location by her son.

158.title: Elizabeth Hurley shares old pics with Warne from their engagement celebration in SL
158.article_body: Late Australian cricketer Shane Warne's ex-fiancée Elizabeth Hurley took to Instagram to share old pictures with Warne from their engagement celebration in Sri Lanka. "My heart aches...I can't be in Australia for Shane's [private] funeral," she wrote. She added, "It seems too cruel that all...people who loved him will never have another Lion hug, but our memories will live forever."

159.title: Vir Das praises Ukrainian comedians for organising show in bomb shelter
159.article_body: Comedian-actor Vir Das reacted to a report saying that comedians in Ukraine's Sumy held a stand-up show in a bomb shelter amid the Russian invasion. The Kyiv Independent, a Ukraine media outlet, shared that three comedians performed for about 100 people in one of the bomb shelters in Sumy. Vir shared the report and dropped a few clapping hands emojis.

160.title: H'wood action choreographer Yannick Ben joins Samantha's 'Yashoda'
160.article_body: Hollywood action choreographer Yannick Ben has been roped in for Samantha Ruth Prabhu's action-thriller 'Yashoda'. Yannick has previously worked in films like 'Transporter 3', 'Inception' and 'Dunkirk'. He has also worked in Indian projects, including 'The Family Man', Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Raees' and Salman Khan's 'Tiger Zinda Hai'. 'Yashoda' will release in multiple languages.

161.title: Eng beat NZ by 1 wicket to register their 2nd win in Women's WC 2022
161.article_body: England defeated New Zealand by one wicket to register their second win in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup 2022. Chasing New Zealand's 203-run total England's Natalie Sciver scored 61 off 108 balls as her side managed to save a wicket and won the match in 47.2 overs. This is New Zealand's fourth defeat in six games in the tournament.

162.title: Woman dies as police constable allegedly shoots her in Punjab, probe on
162.article_body: A woman died after a police constable allegedly shot her in Punjab's Haibowal area. Police rushed to spot and found a dead woman with a bullet injury. "Investigations are going on...prima facie is yet to be confirmed....the accused, who shot the woman, was constable...He has been hospitalised due to a bullet wound by the neighbours," Police said.

163.title: Depression over southeast Bay of Bengal, Andaman Sea to intensify in 24 hrs
163.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) said that Saturday's low-pressure system intensified into a depression over the southeast Bay of Bengal and the adjoining south Andaman Sea on Sunday. The depression will further intensify into a deep depression in the next 24 hours, the IMD added. The IMD had earlier predicted Cyclone Asani over Bay of Bengal on March 21.

164.title: Russian cosmonauts deny flight suits are inspired by Ukrainian flag
164.article_body: Russian cosmonaut Oleg Artemyev denied their flight suits are inspired by Ukrainian flag. He said, "There is no need to look for any hidden symbols." He added that the three cosmonauts who arrived at International Space Station wearing yellow suits with blue accents were graduates of Bauman Moscow State Technical University and had picked the colours of their alma mater.

165.title: China on right side of history: Chinese Minister on Ukraine crisis
165.article_body: Chinese Foreign Affairs Minister Wang Yi told reporters on Saturday that "time will prove" that the country's claims are on the "right side of history" over the Russia-Ukraine conflict. He added that the country stands for maintaining peace and its position is "in line with the wishes of most countries". Earlier, China had said that Russia has "legitimate security concerns".

166.title: Remo D'Souza pays off the loan for a contestant on sets of DID L'il Masters 5
166.article_body: Choreographer Remo D'Souza paid off the loan of an eight-year-old contestant named Himanshu on the DID Li'l Masters 5. Himanshu's mother revealed she is being harassed because she's a female rickshaw puller, and has also landed in a debt to buy the rickshaw. Hearing this, Remo said, "Please let me know the amount that's pending, I will pay it off."

167.title: Kyiv mocks Russia after shooting down their jet, shares meme
167.article_body: The official Twitter account of the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv mocked Russia after shooting down Russia's Su-34. It wrote, "Another Russian Su-34 was shot down near Kyiv. It makes it, what, 94th?" It added, "Wondering what will happen first... the 100th plane or 300 rubles for $1? Tell us what you think!" The Russia-Ukraine war entered its 25th day today.

168.title: 2 dead, 23 rescued as wall of old building undergoing renovation collapses in Guj
168.article_body: Two persons died and 23 others were rescued after the wall of an old commercial building, where renovation work was underway, collapsed in Gujarat's Surat. The wall of the building's second floor collapsed when drilling activity was in progress and injured the two youths, who were standing on the ground. They were declared dead on arrival at a hospital.

169.title: I feel no. 3 is my position, but I'm ready to explore: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer
169.article_body: KKR's newly-appointed captain Shreyas Iyer has said he's ready to bat at any position in the upcoming IPL season. "On a given day, I can be a power-hitter and there can be some other player who can play anchor role...I feel number three is my position [but]...wherever team wants me to bat at...I'm ready to explore," he added.

170.title: 4 pose as ACB officers, extort ₹10 lakh from BDA officers in B'luru
170.article_body: Four men have been arrested for allegedly posing as Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) officers and extorting ₹10 lakh from Bangalore Development Authority (BDA) engineers. The accused reportedly extorted the money under the pretext of removing the engineers' names from ACB's case files. The incident came to light after one of the engineers filed a complaint in the matter.

171.title: 2 dead, 14 injured as dumper rams into 2 vehicles in Haryana's Nuh
171.article_body: Two persons, including a minor, died and 14 persons were injured after a dumper carrying stones allegedly rammed into a tractor thresher and a bus in Haryana's Nuh on Saturday. Locals and relatives of the victims alleged police officials were chasing the dumper to check for illegal mining and they fired a gunshot flattening the dumper's tyre, leading to collision.

172.title: Russia has failed to gain control of air: UK on Ukraine resistance
172.article_body: The UK Ministry of Defence has said the Ukrainian Air Force is continuing to effectively defend Ukrainian airspace. It added, "Russia has failed to gain control of the air and is largely relying on stand-off weapons launched from the relative safety of Russian airspace." It also said that gaining control of the air was one of Russia's principal objectives.

173.title: 20 including kids injured, 1 killed in shooting at car show in US
173.article_body: One person was killed and 20 others, including children, were injured in a shooting outside a car show in Dumas in US' Arkansas on Saturday, police said. One person has been taken into custody, but there may've been multiple shooters, the town's Police Chief Keith Finch said. "For something like this to happen, it's a tragedy," the event's organiser said.

174.title: 24-year-old man attacks worshippers in Canada mosque with bear spray
174.article_body: A 24-year-old man entered a mosque in Canada's Toronto and attacked people with bear spray on Saturday, said police.
