348.article_body: National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) personnel have been deployed in Andaman and Nicobar Islands as IMD predicted Cyclone Asani over Bay of Bengal on March 21. According to the administration, NDRF personnel are ready at different places with all necessary equipment to carry out search and rescue operations. "Fishermen are strongly advised not to venture into sea," the administration tweeted.

349.title: Varun to team up with Atlee for Hindi remake of South film: Reports
349.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan and filmmaker Atlee are reportedly teaming up for the Hindi remake of a South film. "There's a good chance that the film may be Vijay and Samantha starrer 'Theri'," reports stated. The original, which was released in 2016, was also helmed by Atlee. Meanwhile, the filmmaker is currently working on a film with Shah Rukh Khan.

350.title: An honour to play for India: Jhulan on becoming 2nd woman to play 200 ODIs
350.article_body: After she became the second woman cricketer to play 200 ODIs, following India captain Mithali Raj, pacer Jhulan Goswami said it's been an honour to play for India. The 39-year-old achieved this feat in India's match against Australia on Saturday in 2022 Women's World Cup. "It's been a pleasure, whenever I've worn this jersey. It's always been special," Jhulan added.

351.title: Pune's APMC seizes mangoes falsely being sold as Ratnagiri Alphonso
351.article_body: Pune's Agriculture Produce Market Committee (APMC) has seized 42 boxes of mangoes being falsely sold as Alphonso mangoes from Ratnagiri by three wholesale dealers, an official said on Saturday. The seized mangoes had arrived from Karnataka, the official added. Alphonso mangoes from Karnataka are cheaper than the Ratnagiri Alphonso, a mango trader said.

352.title: Just imagine 14,000 dead bodies in that Russian stadium: Zelenskyy on Putin's speech
352.article_body: Commenting on Russian President Vladimir Putin's speech at a packed soccer stadium, Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "Just picture for yourself that in that stadium in Moscow there are 14,000 dead bodies...Those are the Russian costs throughout the invasion." Zelenskyy warned that Russia will lose in the long run if it doesn't end its war.

353.title: Profile of the world's most boring person released by researchers in the UK
353.article_body: British researchers have revealed the profile of the world's most boring person, based on a study on 500 people. The study summed up that the world's most boring person would be a data entry worker who's religious, lives in a town and whose favourite hobby is watching TV. Data analysis, accounting are among the most boring jobs, the study said.

354.title: Baltic countries expel 10 Russian diplomats amid Ukraine war
354.article_body: Latvia, Estonia, and Lithuania have expelled a total of 10 Russian diplomats amid the ongoing Russian invasion of Ukraine, the foreign ministries of the three Baltic nations said. Lithuania has expelled four Russian diplomats, while Estonia and Latvia have expelled three each. "All ungrounded expulsions of Russian diplomats will be met with an appropriate answer," Russia's Foreign Ministry said.

355.title: Businessman to give away free gas worth $1 million as prices hit record high in US
355.article_body: US businessman Willie Wilson has announced that he would be giving away $1 million worth of gas free of cost to Cook County residents from March 24 as prices hit record high in the country. Earlier this week, several cars lined up at gas stations after he announced $200,000 worth of free gas at 10 stations in the city.

356.title: Elon Musk says first humans could land on Mars in 2029
356.article_body: SpaceX CEO in response to a Twitter user said the first humans could land on Mars in 2029. The user had posted a photo showing the 1969 Moon landing along with an image of people on Mars that read, "20_ _?" Last year, Musk had said, in a worst-case scenario, SpaceX would land humans on Mars in 10 years.

357.title: Organs of brain dead man give new lease of life to 6 patients in K'taka
357.article_body: Umesh B Dandagi (51), who was declared brain dead at KLES Hospital in Karnataka's Belagavi, gave new lease of life to six patients. His heart was transplanted to a patient in the same hospital. His kidneys were sent to their respective recipients through green corridor and liver was airlifted to Bengaluru. His corneas and skin were donated to respective banks.

358.title: Anushka Sharma steps away from her production house
358.article_body: Anushka Sharma took to Instagram to announce she's stepping away from her production house Clean Slate Filmz (CSF) which she co-founded with her brother Karnesh. "Being a new mother who has chosen to be an actor by profession...I've decided...whatever time I've at hand...I'll dedicate it to my first love, acting!" she wrote. Clean Slate Filmz was founded in October 2013.

359.title: Camilla takes over Meghan Markle's former theatre patronage
359.article_body: Prince Charles' wife Camilla has taken over Meghan Markle's former theatre patronage. In a tweet, the National Theatre welcomed the Duchess of Cornwall as its Royal Patron. The move makes Camilla one of the first members of royal family to take up Meghan's former royal duties. Notably, National Theatre was among the four patronages passed on to Meghan in 2019.

360.title: 45-yr-old man thrashed to death after argument during Holi celebration
360.article_body: A 45-year-old man, Rajendra, was allegedly beaten to death on Friday following an argument during Holi celebration in Gurugram. After learning about his brother Sonu's clash with his brother-in-law Mithun, the deceased reportedly visited Mithun to sort the matter out where he was attacked with bricks and sticks. He was rushed to a hospital but doctors declared him brought dead.

361.title: Putin fired around 1,000 staff members fearing they would poison him: Report
361.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin allegedly fired about 1,000 personal staff members in February over fears that they would poison him, said a report. Citing a government source, the report said that those who were fired, included cooks, bodyguards, launderers, and secretaries. The report also said that in Russia, the preferred method of assassination is poisoning.

362.title: Every film has its own destiny: Pooja Hegde on mixed reviews for Radhe Shyam
362.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde while talking about receiving mixed reviews for her recently released film 'Radhe Shyam' said every film has its own destiny at the box office. "Sometimes you watch a film and you think it's an okay film but the box office does really well," she added. However, the actress said people praised her despite the film's overall performance.

363.title: 3 attack man with iron rod after he refused to give 'hafta' in Pune; held
363.article_body: Police have arrested three persons for attacking a man with an iron rod in Pune's Kondhwa. The victim alleged the accused told him that they were the goons of the area and he'll have to pay them regular protection money (hafta). However, when he rejected their demand, they attacked him and robbed him of his gold chain worth ₹1.05 lakh.

364.title: 72-yr-old auto-rickshaw driver held for molesting, kidnapping minor in Delhi
364.article_body: A 72-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was arrested for allegedly molesting and kidnapping an 11-year-old girl from Delhi's Bengali Market area on the Barakhamba Road. "The incident came to light on March 17 after the victim's parents...informed...their daughter had gone missing," police said. "The accused was trying to escape with the girl to Uttarakhand's Haridwar," police added.

365.title: 4,000 bikers penalised for not using a helmet on Holi in Mumbai
365.article_body: The Mumbai Police conducted a special drive on Holi and penalised 4,130 bikers for not using helmets. A total of 8,276 fines were issued from Thursday midnight to 7 pm on Friday. As per data, 1,876 fines were issued for violating parking norms, 110 were penalised for wrong side driving and 199 abandoned vehicles were cleared.

366.title: MI miscalculated, they'll surely miss Boult: Rajkumar ahead of IPL 2022
366.article_body: Rajkumar Sharma, childhood coach of Virat Kohli, said MI will miss pacer Trent Boult in upcoming IPL 2022 as he wasn't retained by them in mega auction last month. He added that the Mumbai-based franchise "miscalculated" before the auction. "To make up for Boult's absence, they went for Jaydev Unadkat," Rajkumar added. Boult was bought by RR for ₹8 crore.

367.title: Will hold protests if railway concessions for senior citizens not restored: Pune Cong
367.article_body: Congress' Pune unit has warned the Centre that it will hold protests if concessions for senior citizens on railway tickets are not restored. Congress spokesperson Gopal Tiwari said concession helps senior citizens "in religious journeys and to visit other places". Tiwari added, "We condemn the decision of the Central government."

368.title: Ethereum's billionaire co-founder shares tweets trolling him for TIME cover
368.article_body: Vitalik Buterin, who co-founded the world's second-largest cryptocurrency Ethereum, on Saturday shared screenshots of tweets trolling him for his TIME magazine cover. The billionaire said, "The...tweets...are truly amazing. These are barely even cherry-picked...Highly recommend scrolling." The 28-year-old Russia-born Canadian is among the most influential people in the cryptocurrency world.

369.title: Hopeful CRPF won't be required soon in Northeast, J&K and Naxal-hit areas: Shah
369.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said he is hopeful that soon Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) won't be required in the Northeast, Jammu and Kashmir and Naxal-affected areas in the coming years. Shah added that the CRPF has played an indispensable role in maintaining internal security in these areas. Shah was addressing CRPF's 83rd Raising Day parade in Jammu.

370.title: Dalit man killed over his 'good looks, moustache', says family; Rajasthan police deny
370.article_body: The family of a Dalit man named Jitendrapal Meghwal, who was living in Rajasthan's Pali district, has alleged that he was killed because the accused were jealous of his moustache and good looks. While accused Suraj and Ramesh Singh have been arrested, police said the murder wasn't related to victim's looks but a mutual rivalry related to an old case.

371.title: People crushed by price rise; inflation a tax on all: Rahul Gandhi
371.article_body: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the BJP-led Centre by tweeting that India's poor and middle-class were crushed by the "record price rise" even before the Ukraine war. Gandhi also added that "Inflation is a TAX on ALL Indians...GOI must act now" to protect the Indian citizens. His criticism comes days after Congress' debacle in the recent assembly elections.

372.title: Prostitution racket busted at OYO hotel in Delhi; 3 Uzbek women held
372.article_body: Delhi Police on Tuesday busted an international prostitution racket and arrested six people from an OYO hotel in Pandav Nagar, police said. After receiving information about the prostitution racket being run at the hotel, police carried out a raid on the hotel and arrested the accused, including three women from Uzbekistan. Police have now registered a case into the matter.

373.title: Morality is something: BJP on NCP not seeking Malik's resignation
373.article_body: Maharashtra BJP leader Kripashankar Singh has criticised NCP for not seeking the resignation of Minority Development Minister Nawab Malik. The BJP leader said, "Morality is something. It's a shame if a present minister... is in jail." He added that Malik's resignation should be taken for now and if the court finds him innocent then "he could be made minister again".

374.title: Pune-Solapur flyover likely to reopen tomorrow, to ease traffic congestion
374.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has planned to reopen the Pune-Solapur flyover at Hadapsar from tomorrow, easing traffic congestion. The flyover would resume traffic on one lane, Pune towards Solapur, for light-weight vehicles, however, heavy vehicles will be allowed after a month. The flyover was shut in February after local representatives complained of damage to a portion of the flyover.

375.title: 13-yr-old, mother die as SUV hits auto in Delhi; 21-yr-old driver held
375.article_body: Four of a family were severely injured, of whom a 13-year-boy and his mother died, after an SUV, being driven by a 21-year-old third-year college student, hit an auto-rickshaw on the Barapullah flyover on Friday. After hitting the auto-rickshaw, the accused also hit another car. Police said the accused has been arrested and an investigation is underway.

376.title: Morris Chestnut to be honoured with a star on Hollywood Walk of Fame
376.article_body: Morris Chestnut, who starred in 'Anacondas: The Hunt for the Blood Orchid', will be honoured with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. The 53-year-old actor will be the 2,716th celebrity to receive a star on the walkway. "We're proud to welcome him to our famed Walk of Fame," said Ana Martinez, Producer of the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

377.title: Krunal will be laughing at me: Hardik on facing LSG in GT's IPL 2022 opener
377.article_body: GT skipper Hardik Pandya said his brother and LSG all-rounder Krunal Pandya will be "laughing" at him when he walks out for his first toss, in GT's IPL 2022 opener against LSG. "Krunal...has never seen me [go for the toss]," added Hardik, revealing the reason behind his brother's reaction. GT will take on LSG on March 28 at Wankhede Stadium.

378.title: Universal Music label acquires Bored Ape NFT for $360,817
378.article_body: Universal Music Group has bought one of the Bored Apes NFTs for $360,817. The group has purchased Bored Ape #5537, a female character now known as Manager Noët All, which will lead its virtual NFT band, called Kingship, as the manager. Prior to the new joining, Kingship consisted of four digital characters, one mutant ape and three bored ape NFTs.

379.title: Don Young, longest-serving US congressman, passes away at 88
379.article_body: US Republican Representative Don Young, who was the longest-serving member of Congress, passed away at the age of 88 on Friday. The congressman died while travelling home to Alaska, his office said in a statement. "Don Young's legacy as a fighter for the state will live on, as will his fundamental goodness and honour. We'll miss him dearly," it added.

380.title: Which states have the highest active COVID-19 cases in India?
380.article_body: India currently has 27,802 active COVID-19 cases, with 15 states/UTs currently having more than 500 active COVID-19 cases. Kerala has the highest active COVID-19 cases at 7,289, followed by Maharashtra (5,684) and Mizoram (2,127). Karnataka has 2,055 active COVID-19 cases, while Assam and West Bengal also have more than 1,000 active COVID-19 cases.

381.title: Ukrainian bridal gown brand is now making military nets, vests for soldiers
381.article_body: A Ukrainian brand known for its wedding gowns is now also producing military nets and assault vests for the country's soldiers and medical workers amid the war with Russia. "Along with making brides around the globe happy, we are focused on saving our country," said Milla Nova's CEO Ulyana Kyrychuk. The CEO said they have already made 1,500 items.

382.title: TCS reappoints Rajesh Gopinathan as CEO and MD for five years
382.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has reappointed Rajesh Gopinathan as its Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and Managing Director (MD) for five years. The company's board has also extended the term of Ganapathy Subramaniam as Chief Operating Officer and Executive Director to May 2024, as per its retirement age policy. Both Gopinathan and Subramaniam have held their respective positions since 2017.

383.title: Great Barrier Reef suffers severe coral bleaching due to high temperature
383.article_body: According to the Australian government agency, the Great Barrier Reef is suffering widespread and severe coral bleaching due to high ocean temperatures. "Bleaching has been detected across the Marine Park - it's widespread but variable, across multiple regions, ranging in impact from minor to severe," the authority added. The bleaching that occurred two years back damaged two-thirds of the coral.

384.title: 4-yr UG programmes to start at Pune university from academic year 2022-23
384.article_body: The Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) is going to introduce four-year undergraduate programmes from the academic year 2022-23. The University Grants Commission (UGC) had released draft guidelines on four-year UG programmes, which was proposed in the National Education Policy. SPPU VC said the new programme will help students in research and further studies, while also pursuing a PhD.

385.title: Demonising Kashmiri Muslims doesn't help Kashmiri Pandits: Tharoor
385.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Saturday, while sharing a Facebook post about Vivek Agnihotri's film 'The Kashmir Files' on Twitter, said, "Kashmiri Pandits suffered terribly...But demonising Kashmiri Muslims doesn't help the Pandits either." "Hatred divides and kills. Kashmiris need justice. All need to be heard, helped and healed," Tharoor added.

386.title: Russia to work on its own Mars mission after Europe suspends project: Report
386.article_body: Russia will start working on its own Mars mission after Europe's ESA announced the suspension of a joint project following the Ukraine invasion, the Interfax news agency reported. The ESA had said it would be impossible to continue cooperating with Russia on the ExoMars mission. Roscosmos head said there were "big doubts" about what the ESA could do without Russia.

387.title: Smoke from wildfires destroys ozone layer: Study
387.article_body: Smoke from wildfires can destroy the ozone layer, a study by the University of Waterloo has found. "The Australian fires injected acidic smoke particles into the stratosphere, disrupting the chlorine, hydrogen and nitrogen chemistry that regulate ozone," the lead author of the study said. The smoke converts these ozone-regulating compounds into more reactive compounds that destroy ozone, he added.

388.title: Australia record highest successful chase in Women's World Cup history, defeat India
388.article_body: Australia chased down a 278-run target against India on Saturday to record the highest successful run chase in Women's World Cup history. The previous highest successful run chase in Women's World Cups had come in 2017, when Australia chased down a 258-run target against Sri Lanka. Australia have won each of their five 2022 Women's World Cup matches so far.

389.title: Ukraine temporarily lost access to Sea of Azov: Defence Ministry
389.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Ministry said it had "temporarily" lost access to the Sea of Azov. The ministry didn't specify whether Ukraine had regained access to the sea, but said that Russian forces had been pushed back from approaches toward the southern city of Mykolaiv. Russia on Friday had said it was "tightening the noose" around the besieged port city of Mariupol.

390.title: Won't see a young player as good as Shaw in my life: PBKS batting consultant
390.article_body: Sharing his experience on watching Prithvi Shaw bat when he was eight years old, PBKS' batting consultant Julian Wood said he will never see a young player as good as Shaw again in his life. "I have never seen a boy that young technically so sound," added Wood. "He hit the ball very hard for someone so small," stated Wood.

391.title: Satellite pics show destruction in Ukraine's Mariupol after Russian bombing
391.article_body: Ukraine's Centre for Strategic Communications and Information Security took to Twitter to share satellite pictures showing destruction in Ukraine's Mariupol after Russian attack. "This is Mariupol, showing devastation to residential homes, apartment buildings and stores in north and west of the port city in Ukraine," it wrote. Russia also destroyed a theatre sheltering civilians in the city.

392.title: England in danger for too much reliance on Root, Stokes: Nick Compton
392.article_body: Ex-England batter Nick Compton said England have been in danger for being too reliant on Joe Root and Ben Stokes for a while. Root and Stokes scored 153 and 120 respectively in the first innings of England's Barbados Test against West Indies. Dan Lawrence was the next top run-getter with 91 runs as England declared having scored 507 runs.

393.title: Taliban frees journalists detained over report on TV show censoring
393.article_body: The Taliban have released three employees of Afghanistan's largest television station, TOLONews, for allegedly reporting on the Taliban government's decision to ban the broadcast of foreign TV series in the country. The UN and press freedom organisations had condemned the journalists' arrest. Reportedly, over 230 media outlets have shut down in Afghanistan since the Taliban seized power in August.

394.title: Russia uses Kinzhal hypersonic missiles in Ukraine
394.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry has said that the country used hypersonic Kinzhal missiles in Ukraine, according to an Interfax report. "The Kinzhal aviation missile system with hypersonic aeroballistic missiles destroyed a large underground warehouse containing missiles and aviation ammunition in the village of Deliatyn in the Ivano-Frankivsk region," the ministry added.

395.title: 'The Kashmir Files' earns ₹19.15 cr on day 8, more than Aamir Khan's 'Dangal'
395.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' has crossed the ₹100 crore mark in India. According to film trade analyst Taran Adarsh, the Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri directorial earned more money on day eight than Aamir Khan's 'Dangal'. "#TheKashmirFiles creates history. Day 8 of The Kashmir Files [₹19.15 cr] is AT PAR with #Baahubali2 [₹19.75 cr] and higher than #Dangal [₹18.59 cr]," he tweeted.

396.title: 'The Batman' actor Paul Dano to write comic book about Riddler
396.article_body: Actor Paul Dano, who played The Riddler in Robert Pattinson-starrer 'The Batman', is writing a comic exploring the origins of the supervillain. Titled 'Riddler: Year One', the comic will launch in stores in October, DC shared on Twitter. 'The Batman', directed by Matt Reeves, has earned more than $500 million at the worldwide box office.

397.title: It's a sweet story: Shreyas on his next directorial 'Sar Car Ki Seva Mei'
397.article_body: Shreyas Talpade, who's currently working on his second directorial, tentatively titled 'Sar Car Ki Seva Mei', spoke about the upcoming film in an interview. Describing the film as a "sweet little story", he said it's about a man whose car gets stolen and what he does to get it back. "I play that part...and direct it as well," Shreyas said.

398.title: Hyderabad City Police arrest 11 people for gambling
398.article_body: Hyderabad's Trimulgherry Police on Friday arrested 11 people for gambling. Acting on a tip-off, the police raided a house in Saraswathi Nagar and arrested the accused. The police also seized ₹11,600 cash, 10 cell phones and playing cards from the accused. According to police, prime accused S Satyanarayana had been previously involved in similar offences in the city.

399.title: Cong names Ripun Bora, Jeby Mather as RS candidates from Assam, Kerala
399.article_body: Rajya Sabha MP Ripun Bora and Kerala Pradesh Mahila Congress President Jeby Mather have been named as the Congress candidates for the biennial elections to Rajya Sabha from Assam and Kerala respectively. Bora was first elected to the Upper House in March 2016 while Mather has never been elected yet. The candidatures were approved by Congress President Sonia Gandhi.

400.title: 65-yr-old man killed in Guj as two groups clash over playing cricket match
400.article_body: A 65-year-old man was killed when two communities clashed over playing a cricket match in  Sandalpur village of Gujarat's Navsari district. The incident occurred on Friday after an argument broke out between the groups and people attacked each other with deadly weapons. According to Navsari DSP, a case was registered against 32 people following cross FIRs from both sides.

401.title: Google accused of systemic bias against Black employees
401.article_body: Google has been accused of systemic racial bias against Black employees, claiming it drives them towards lower-level jobs, pays them less and denies them opportunities. The lawsuit said Google maintains a "racially biased corporate culture" that favours white men, with Black people comprising only 4.4% of employees. It allegedly also subjected Black employees to a hostile work environment.

402.title: Indrani Mukerjea gets bail in 2017 Byculla jail rioting case
402.article_body: Former media executive Indrani Mukerjea has been granted bail in connection to a case lodged following rioting in Byculla jail in 2017. The accused, including Indrani and over 30 inmates, had caused damage to prison property as well as injured six prison guards during the rioting. Indrani is also accused of killing her daughter Sheena Bora in 2012.
